title: Sri Lanka rupee at 364.5 to TT dollar, interbank rupee at 359.25
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 364.5 against telegraphic transfers on Friday (27) while the central bank interbank spot trade was at 359.25 under a daily guidance rate.
Commercial banks were quoting 354.5/364.5 for telegraphic transfer dollars on Friday.
On Thursday, the central bank guidance margin was set at plus 2.50 rupees or minus 3.00 rupees.

Sri Lanka’s central bank governor warned that the country is yet to see its worst economic contraction in its history as its struggling to import goods while industries also warn of raw material shortages.

The central bank stopped quoting day rates on January 23 when the rupee was floated with an interest rate correction after the soft peg collapsed, amid a war. In 2021 and the central bank also started enforcing a rate incompatible with the policy rate at around 203 to the US dollar.
The central bank from August 2021 to April has hiked rates by almost 9 percent and in April alone the rates were hiked by 7 percent.
The secondary market was dull in mid-day trade on Friday ahead of Monday’s 40 billion rupees bond auction.
Three-month bills were quoted at around 22.00/22.50 percent in mid-day trade, down from 22.00/22.15 percent on Thursday.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2025 was quoted around 22.55/22.65 percent on Friday, wider from 22.55/22.60 percent on Wednesday.
